ground_truth: They are swarming into it as Ron looks around nervously. Harry stoops and goes into the tunnel with Fang just ahead, and breathing hard, Ron hesitates for a moment then follows his friend. The tunnel lies dark and glow, making it impossible to stand upright. They do not see a very large spider which drops from the roof behind them, silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots; Harry and Ron follow the spiders as they swarm across it. But the path stops at a huge hole in the ground surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. The guide disappeared into the hole, and unable to go further, the boys stopped a little away from it. Harry holds up the lantern, unsure of what to do next, and Harry and Ron back away as several long hairy legs emerge from the hole, and a huge spider as big as a double-decker bus holds itself above the edge and peers down at them. It has a hairy face and its tiny eyes are set close together, and the boys stare open-mouthed as Ron stops whimpering. Ron points upwards with a shaking hand, and Harry looks up to see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots to dangle about their heads. He nods politely to Aragog, and Harry swings the lantern but drops it. They pull out their wands as the spiders close in. It's the Ford Anglia, and it stops with the doors flying open. Fang jumps into the back seat, Ron into the front, and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the spiders attack. Scattering spiders, Ron backs the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. The car hits the ground and comes to a halt, dislodging the lost spider, which grabs Ron through the open window. Harry points his wand and the spider is hurled backwards, and Ron looks at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge spiders appearing from amongst the shadowy trees and moving towards the car, ready to attack again. Ron starts the car, puts it into reverse, turns the car, and accelerates. The spiders scuttle close behind the car as it jolts away between the trees, and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of spiders. Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grabs the gear stick, while spiders lurk in the trees ready to jump on the car. Huge spiders loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick, and the car rises into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering spiders.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: They are swarming into it as Ron glances around anxiously. Harry bends and enters the passageway with Fang just ahead, and inhaling hard, Ron pauses for a second then follows his companion. The passageway lies dimly and shining, making it impossible to stand upright. They do not notice a very large arachnid which descends from the ceiling behind them, silhouetted against the glow from the passageway entrance. The passageway gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with tangled tree roots; Harry and Ron pursue the arachnids as they swarm across it. But the route halts at a huge pit in the ground surrounded by crumpled webs. The guide vanished into the pit, and unable to proceed further, the boys halted a little away from it. Harry raises the lamp, uncertain of what to do next, and Harry and Ron retreat as several long hairy limbs emerge from the pit, and a huge arachnid as large as a double-decker bus hoists itself above the rim and gazes down at them. It has a hairy visage and its tiny eyes are set close together, and the boys gaze open-mouthed as Ron stops whimpering. Ron gestures upwards with a shaking hand, and Harry glances up to see dozens of large arachnids lowering themselves from the tree roots to hang about their heads. He nods courteously to Aragog, and Harry swings the lamp but drops it. They draw out their wands as the arachnids converge. It's the Ford Anglia, and it halts with the doors flinging open. Fang leaps into the back seat, Ron into the front, and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the arachnids assault. Scattering arachnids, Ron reverses the automobile out around the tree roots and back along the narrow passageway. The automobile hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. The automobile strikes the ground and comes to a halt, dislodging the lost arachnid, which seizes Ron through the open window. Harry directs his wand and the arachnid is hurled backwards, and Ron glances at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge arachnids emerging from amongst the shadowy trees and advancing towards the automobile, ready to assault again. Ron starts the automobile, puts it into reverse, turns the automobile, and speeds up. The arachnids scuttle closely behind the automobile as it jolts away between the trees, and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of arachnids. Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grips the gear stick, while arachnids lurk in the trees ready to leap on the automobile. Huge arachnids loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick, and the automobile rises into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering arachnids.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The tunnel is swarmed into by them as Ron looks around nervously. Harry stoops and is followed into the tunnel by Fang just ahead, and breathing hard, a moment is hesitated by Ron before he follows his friend. Darkness and a glow make it impossible for them to stand upright in the tunnel. They do not see a very large spider which drops from the roof behind them, silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots; the spiders are followed by Harry and Ron as they swarm across it. But the path is stopped by a huge hole in the ground surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. The guide disappears into the hole, and unable to go further, a stop is made by the boys a little away from it. The lantern is held up by Harry, unsure of what to do next, and backing away are Harry and Ron as several long hairy legs emerge from the hole, and they are held above the edge by a huge spider as big as a double-decker bus which peers down at them. A hairy face is had by it and tiny eyes are set close together, and open-mouthed stares are given by the boys as Ron stops whimpering. Upwards is pointed by Ron with a shaking hand, and up looks Harry to see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots to dangle about their heads. A polite nod is given to Aragog by him, and the lantern is swung by Harry but dropped. Their wands are pulled out by them as the spiders close in. It's the Ford Anglia, and with the doors flying open, a stop is made by it. Into the back seat jumps Fang, the front is taken by Ron, and the passenger seat is dived for by Harry as the spiders attack. Spiders are scattered as the car is backed out by Ron around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. Backwards is hurtled by the car out of the entrance and through the air it flies. The ground is hit by the car and it is halted, dislodging the lost spider, which is grabbed through the open window by Ron. His wand is pointed by Harry and the spider is hurled backwards, and with relief, looks Ron at Harry. Harry's eyes are suddenly opened wide by him as the cracked windscreen is looked through to see hundreds of huge spiders appearing from amongst the shadowy trees and moving towards the car, ready to attack again. Ron starts the car, it is put into reverse, the car is turned, and it is accelerated. Close behind the car scuttle the spiders as a jolt is made by it away between the trees, and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of spiders. In desperation, Harry turns to Ron as the gear stick is grabbed by Ron, while lurking in the trees are spiders ready to jump on the car. Ahead of them loom huge spiders as the gear stick is heaved on by both, and into the air the car rises, smashing into a branch and scattering spiders.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: They swarm in as Ron looks around nervously. Harry stoops into the tunnel with Fang just ahead, and breathing hard, Ron hesitates before following. The dark, glowing tunnel is too low to stand upright. Behind them, a large spider drops from the roof, silhouetted in the entrance light. The tunnel opens into a dim hollow of twisted tree roots; Harry and Ron follow the spiders swarming across it. The path ends at a huge hole surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. Their guide disappears inside, and the boys stop short. Harry raises the lantern uncertainly as several hairy legs rise from the hole. A spider, as big as a double-decker bus, peers down at them, hairy-faced with close-set eyes. Ron stops whimpering and points upward. Harry looks to see dozens of large spiders descending from roots above. He nods at Aragog, then drops the lantern. They draw their wands as the spiders approach. The Ford Anglia appears, doors flinging open. Fang jumps into the back, Ron into the front, and Harry dives in as the spiders attack. Ron reverses, scattering spiders, steering through roots and the tunnel. The car bursts out, flies through the air, and stops, dislodging a spider that grabs Ron. Harry casts a spell, hurling it off. Ron gives him a relieved look. But Harry sees hundreds of huge spiders emerging from the trees. Ron starts the car, reverses, turns, and speeds off. Spiders scuttle behind them as they jolt between trees; the forest floor seethes. Harry turns to Ron, desperate, as Ron grabs the gear stick. Spiders lurk, ready to leap. They both yank the stick, and the car lifts, smashing a branch and scattering spiders.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Ron looks around nervously as they swarm in. Harry stoops into the tunnel with Fang, and Ron hesitates before following. The dark tunnel prevents standing upright. A large spider drops behind them, silhouetted by the entrance light. The tunnel opens into a dim hollow with tree roots; they follow the spiders to a huge hole surrounded by cobwebs. Unable to proceed, they stop. Harry holds the lantern as a massive spider emerges. Ron points up, and Harry sees spiders lowering from the roots. He nods to Aragog, drops the lantern, and they draw wands as spiders close in. The Ford Anglia arrives, doors open. Fang jumps in, Ron and Harry follow as spiders attack. Ron reverses the car through the tunnel, flying out the entrance. A spider grabs Ron, but Harry repels it. More spiders approach, and Ron starts the car, reversing and accelerating. Spiders chase the car, and Harry and Ron struggle with the gear stick, lifting the car into the air, scattering spiders.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As they swarm into the tunnel, Ron glances around with a nervous expression, clearly feeling uneasy about the situation. Harry bends down and enters the tunnel, with Fang just a little ahead of him, leading the way. Breathing heavily, Ron hesitates for a brief moment, then decides to follow his friend into the darkness. The tunnel is dark and has a faint glow, making it impossible for them to stand upright comfortably. Unbeknownst to them, a very large spider silently drops from the roof behind them, its silhouette visible against the faint light coming from the tunnel entrance. As they continue, the tunnel gradually opens up into a large, dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots. Harry and Ron follow the spiders as they swarm across this space. However, their path comes to an abrupt stop at a huge hole in the ground, which is surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. Their guide disappears into the hole, and unable to proceed further, the boys stop a short distance away from it. Harry raises the lantern, feeling uncertain about what to do next. As they back away, several long, hairy legs emerge from the hole, and a gigantic spider, as large as a double-decker bus, lifts itself above the edge and peers down at them. Its face is covered in hair, and its tiny eyes are set close together. The boys stare in shock, their mouths open, as Ron stops whimpering. With a trembling hand, Ron points upwards, prompting Harry to look up and see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots, dangling ominously above their heads. Harry nods politely to Aragog, and as he swings the lantern, it slips from his grasp and falls. They quickly pull out their wands as the spiders begin to close in on them. Suddenly, the Ford Anglia appears, coming to a stop with its doors flying open. Fang leaps into the back seat, Ron scrambles into the front, and Harry dives for the passenger seat just as the spiders launch their attack. As the spiders scatter, Ron maneuvers the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. Upon hitting the ground, the car comes to a halt, dislodging a spider that grabs Ron through the open window. Harry points his wand, and the spider is hurled backwards, prompting Ron to look at Harry with a sense of relief. Suddenly, Harry's eyes widen as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of enormous spiders emerging from the shadowy trees, moving towards the car, ready to attack once more. Ron starts the car, shifts it into reverse, turns it around, and accelerates. The spiders scuttle closely behind the car as it jolts away between the trees, and the forest floor becomes a seething mass of spiders. In desperation, Harry turns to Ron as Ron grabs the gear stick, while spiders lurk in the trees, poised to jump onto the car. Huge spiders loom ahead of them, and together they heave on the gear stick, causing the car to rise into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering spiders in all directions.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As they begin to swarm into the shadowy tunnel, Ron glances nervously around him with an expression of deep unease etched on his face, clearly feeling quite unsettled by the whole situation. Harry, without hesitation, bends down and cautiously enters the narrow tunnel, with the faithful Fang just a little ahead of him, leading the way through the darkness. Breathing heavily, Ron hesitates for a brief moment, considering his options, then ultimately decides to follow his friend into the foreboding darkness. The tunnel is pitch dark, save for a faint glow, making it nearly impossible for them to stand upright and move comfortably. Unbeknownst to them, a significantly large spider silently drops from the roof right behind them, its intimidating silhouette visible against the faint, distant light that emanates from the tunnel entrance. As they cautiously continue their journey, the tunnel gradually opens up into a rather large, dimly lit hollow space filled with twisted, gnarled tree roots. Harry and Ron, keeping close, follow the spiders as they swarm across this eerie space. However, to their dismay, their path comes to an abrupt stop at a massive hole in the ground, which is surrounded by crumpled, dusty cobwebs. Their eight-legged guide disappears into this yawning hole, and unable to proceed any further, the boys halt a short distance away from it. Harry raises the lantern high, feeling uncertain and unsure about what to do next. As they cautiously back away, several long, hairy legs emerge ominously from the hole, and a gigantic spider, as large as a double-decker bus, lifts itself menacingly above the edge and peers down at them. Its face is covered in coarse hair, and its beady, tiny eyes are set closely together. The boys stare in utter shock, their mouths agape, as Ron stops whimpering momentarily. With a trembling hand, Ron points upwards, prompting Harry to instinctively look up and see dozens of dauntingly large spiders lowering themselves from the dark tree roots, dangling ominously above their heads. Harry nods politely to Aragog, and as he swings the lantern in an attempt to steady himself, it slips from his grasp and falls. They quickly pull out their wands as the spiders begin to close in. Suddenly, the Ford Anglia, like a savior, appears, coming to a screeching stop with its doors flying open. Fang leaps into the back seat with agility, Ron scrambles frantically into the front, and Harry dives hastily for the passenger seat just as the spiders launch their attack. As the spiders scatter chaotically, Ron maneuvers the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow, confined tunnel. The car, driven by urgency, hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. Upon hitting the ground with a jarring thud, the car abruptly comes to a halt, dislodging a menacing spider that grabs Ron through the open window. Harry swiftly points his wand, and the spider is hurled backwards with force, prompting Ron to glance at Harry with an expression of palpable relief. Suddenly, Harry's eyes widen in horror as he looks through the cracked windscreen to behold hundreds of enormous spiders emerging from the shadowy trees, moving menacingly towards the car, ready to attack once more. Ron quickly starts the car, shifts it into reverse with urgency, turns it around deftly, and accelerates. The spiders scuttle closely behind, hot on their trail, as the car jolts away between the towering trees, and the forest floor rapidly becomes a seething mass of spiders. In a moment of desperation, Harry turns to Ron as Ron grabs the gear stick with determination, while terrifying spiders lurk ominously in the trees, poised to jump onto the car. Huge spiders loom ahead, and together they heave on the gear stick with all their might, causing the car to rise unexpectedly into the air, smashing violently into a branch and scattering the spiders in all directions.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As they swarm into the tunnel, Ron casts nervous glances around, his eyes darting from side to side. Harry bends down, lowering his head to enter the tunnel, with Fang just ahead of him, leading the way. Breathing heavily, Ron pauses momentarily, his hesitation palpable, before he gathers his courage and follows Harry into the darkness. The tunnel is shrouded in shadows and a faint glow, forcing them to stoop as they move forward, unable to stand upright due to the low ceiling. Unbeknownst to them, a very large spider silently descends from the roof behind them, its silhouette briefly visible against the dim light filtering in from the tunnel entrance. As they proceed, the tunnel gradually widens, revealing a large, dimly lit hollow where twisted tree roots snake across the ground. Harry and Ron continue to follow the spiders, which swarm across the hollow, leading them onward. Their path abruptly ends at a massive hole in the ground, encircled by crumpled cobwebs. The spiders, their guides, disappear into the hole, leaving Harry and Ron standing a short distance away, unable to continue. Harry raises the lantern, its light flickering uncertainly, as he ponders their next move. Suddenly, they both step back in alarm as several long, hairy legs emerge from the hole, and a gigantic spider, as large as a double-decker bus, hoists itself above the edge, peering down at them with a hairy face and tiny eyes set close together. The boys stand frozen, mouths agape, as Ron's whimpering ceases. With a trembling hand, Ron points upwards, prompting Harry to look up and see dozens of large spiders descending from the tree roots, dangling ominously above their heads. In a gesture of politeness, Harry nods to Aragog, but as he swings the lantern, it slips from his grasp and falls. Quickly, they draw their wands as the spiders close in, their intentions clear. Just then, the Ford Anglia bursts onto the scene, skidding to a stop with its doors flung open. Fang leaps into the back seat, Ron scrambles into the front, and Harry dives into the passenger seat as the spiders launch their attack. With spiders scattering in their wake, Ron maneuvers the car around the tree roots and reverses along the narrow tunnel. The car hurtles backwards, bursting out of the tunnel entrance and soaring through the air. Upon landing, the car jolts to a stop, dislodging a spider that clings to Ron through the open window. Harry swiftly points his wand, sending the spider hurtling backwards, and Ron glances at Harry, his face a mix of relief and gratitude. Suddenly, Harry's eyes widen in alarm as he peers through the cracked windscreen, spotting hundreds of enormous spiders emerging from the shadowy trees, advancing towards the car with renewed aggression. Ron quickly starts the car, shifts into reverse, and turns the vehicle, accelerating away as the spiders scuttle closely behind. The forest floor becomes a writhing mass of spiders as the car jolts forward between the trees. In desperation, Harry turns to Ron, who grips the gear stick tightly, while spiders lurk in the trees, poised to leap onto the car. As huge spiders loom ahead, both boys heave on the gear stick, causing the car to rise into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering spiders in all directions.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Ron looks around nervously, they swarm into the tunnel, with Harry and Fang leading and Ron hesitating before following. The dark, low tunnel opens into a large hollow filled with twisted tree roots, where they follow the spiders to a huge hole surrounded by cobwebs. Unable to proceed, they stop as a massive spider emerges, prompting Ron to point out more spiders descending from above. Harry nods to Aragog, but drops the lantern as they prepare to defend themselves with their wands. Suddenly, the Ford Anglia arrives, and they quickly jump in as the spiders attack. Ron reverses the car through the tunnel, scattering spiders, and it flies out of the entrance. After a brief struggle with a spider, Harry helps Ron, and they see more spiders approaching. Ron starts the car, and they speed away, dodging spiders and eventually taking flight, smashing through a branch and scattering more spiders.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They are swarming into it as Ron looks around nervously. Ron, known for his fear of spiders due to a childhood trauma involving magical mischief by his brothers, is understandably anxious. Harry stoops and goes into the tunnel with Fang, a massive and loyal boarhound owned by Hagrid, just ahead, and breathing hard, Ron hesitates for a moment then follows his friend. The tunnel, part of the Forbidden Forest which is infamous for its dangerous creatures, lies dark and glow, making it impossible to stand upright. They do not see a very large spider which drops from the roof behind them, silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots; Harry and Ron follow the spiders, a trait of the Acromantula, as they swarm across it. But the path stops at a huge hole in the ground surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. The guide, an Acromantula known for leading prey to the colony, disappeared into the hole, and unable to go further, the boys stopped a little away from it. Harry holds up the lantern, unsure of what to do next, and Harry and Ron back away as several long hairy legs emerge from the hole, and a huge spider as big as a double-decker bus, which is Aragog, an Acromantula and a friend of Hagrid, holds itself above the edge and peers down at them. It has a hairy face and its tiny eyes are set close together, and the boys stare open-mouthed as Ron stops whimpering. Ron, his bravery returning at the sight of danger, points upwards with a shaking hand, and Harry looks up to see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots to dangle about their heads. He nods politely to Aragog, recognizing his attempts to communicate with the creature, and Harry swings the lantern but drops it. They pull out their wands as the spiders close in. It's the Ford Anglia, enchanted by Ron's father to fly, and it stops with the doors flying open. Fang jumps into the back seat, Ron into the front, and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the spiders attack. Scattering spiders, Ron backs the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air, exhibiting its ability to navigate both ground and air. The car hits the ground and comes to a halt, dislodging the lost spider, which grabs Ron through the open window. Harry points his wand and the spider is hurled backwards, demonstrating a defensive spell, and Ron looks at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge spiders appearing from amongst the shadowy trees, a reminder of the dense and magical ecosystem of the Forbidden Forest, and moving towards the car, ready to attack again. Ron starts the car, puts it into reverse, turns the car, and accelerates. The spiders scuttle close behind the car as it jolts away between the trees, and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of spiders. Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grabs the gear stick, while spiders lurk in the trees, poised like sentinels, ready to jump on the car. Huge spiders loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick, prompting the enchanted car to fly using its magically enhanced abilities, and the car rises into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering spiders.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Ron hesitates for a moment then follows his friend. The tunnel lies dark and glow making it impossible to stand upright. They do not see a very large spider which drops from the roof behind them silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots. Harry and Ron follow the spiders as they swarm across it. But the path stops at a huge hole in the ground surrounded by crumpled cobwebs. The guide disappeared into the hole and unable to go further the boys stopped a little away from it. Harry holds up the lantern unsure of what to do next and Harry and Ron back away as several long hairy legs emerge from the hole and a huge spider as big as a doubledecker bus holds itself above the edge and peers down at them. It has a hairy face and its tiny eyes are set close together and the boys stare openmouthed as Ron stops whimpering. Ron points upwards with a shaking hand and Harry looks up to see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots to dangle about their heads. He nods politely to Aragog and Harry swings the lantern but drops it. They pull out their wands as the spiders close in. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. It is the Ford Anglia and it stops with the doors flying open. Fang jumps into the back seat. Ron into the front and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the spiders attack. Scattering spiders. Ron backs the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. The car hits the ground and comes to a halt dislodging the lost spider which grabs Ron through the open window. Harry points his wand and the spider is hurled backwards and Ron looks at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge spiders appearing from amongst the shadowy trees and moving towards the car ready to attack again. Ron starts the car puts it into reverse turns the car and accelerates. The spiders scuttle close behind the car as it jolts away between the trees and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of spiders. Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grabs the gear stick while spiders lurk in the trees. ready to jump on the car. Huge spiders loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick and the car rises into the air smashing into a branch and scattering spiders.

Harry stoops and goes into the alleyway with Fang just ahead, and breathing hard, Ron hesitates for a moment then follows his friend. The alleyway gradually opens out into a large dimly lit cave filled with twisted vines; Harry and Ron follow the bats as they swarm across it. But the path stops at a huge pit in the ground surrounded by crumpled leaves. The guide disappeared into the pit, and unable to go further, the boys stopped a little away from it. Harry holds up the flashlight, unsure of what to do next, and Harry and Ron back away as several long hairy wings emerge from the pit, and a huge bat as big as a double-decker bus holds itself above the edge and peers down at them. It has a hairy face and its tiny eyes are set close together, and the boys stare open-mouthed as Ron stops whimpering. Ron points upwards with a shaking hand, and Harry looks up to see dozens of large bats lowering themselves from the vines to dangle about their heads. He nods politely to Aragog, and Harry swings the flashlight but drops it. They pull out their wands as the bats close in. It's the Ford Anglia, and it stops with the doors flying open. Fang jumps into the back seat, Ron into the front, and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the bats attack. Scattering bats, Ron backs the car out around the vines and back along the narrow alleyway. The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air. The car hits the ground and comes to a halt, dislodging the lost bat, which grabs Ron through the open window. Harry points his wand and the bat is hurled backwards, and Ron looks at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge bats appearing from amongst the shadowy bushes and moving towards the car, ready to attack again. Ron starts the car, puts it into reverse, turns the car, and accelerates. The bats scuttle close behind the car as it jolts away between the bushes, and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of bats. Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grabs the gear stick, while bats lurk in the trees ready to jump on the car. Huge bats loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick, and the car rises into the air, smashing into a branch and scattering bats.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They are spilling into it as Ron glances around anxiously. Harry crouches and slips into the tunnel with Fang just in front, and breathing heavily, Ron pauses for a moment then trails his friend. The tunnel sprawls dim and gleam, making it impossible to stand upright. They do not detect a very large spider which swings from the roof behind them, silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually expands into a large dimly lit hollow filled with tangling tree roots; Harry and Ron trail the spiders as they scamper across it. But the path halts at a huge pit in the ground surrounded by tattered cobwebs. The guide vanished into the pit, and unable to proceed, the boys linger a little away from it. Harry lifts the lantern, uncertain of what to do next, and Harry and Ron recoil as several long hairy legs protrude from the pit, and a huge spider as big as a double-decker bus perches above the edge and peers down at them. It has a furry face and its tiny eyes are grouped close together, and the boys gaze open-mouthed as Ron stops moaning. Ron gestures upwards with a quivering hand, and Harry glances up to see dozens of large spiders descending from the tree roots to hover about their heads. He bows politely to Aragog, and Harry swings the lantern but lets it fall. They extract their wands as the spiders converge. It's the Ford Anglia, and it halts with the doors flying open. Fang leaps into the back seat, Ron into the front, and Harry lunges for the passenger seat as the spiders ambush. Dispelling spiders, Ron steers the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel. The car dashes backwards out of the entrance and soars through the air. The car crashes to the ground and skids to a stop, dislodging the lost spider, which clutches Ron through the open window. Harry waves his wand and the spider is propelled backwards, and Ron glances at Harry with relief. Harry's eyes suddenly widen as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge spiders emerging from amongst the shadowy trees and nearing the car, eager to confront again. Ron nudges the car, puts it into reverse, swings the car, and speeds up. The spiders scramble close behind the car as it jerks away between the trees, and the floor of the forest is a teeming mass of spiders. Harry turns to Ron in urgency as Ron yanks the gear stick, while spiders lurk in the trees poised to pounce on the car. Huge spiders advance ahead of them as they both tug on the gear stick, and the car ascends into the air, crashing into a branch and scattering spiders.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They are flooding into it as Sal glances around anxiously. Mike bends and enters the cavern with Spot just ahead, and panting, Sal pauses for a second then joins his companion. The cavern lies dim and shimmering, making it impractical to stand erect. They do not notice a very large beetle which descends from the ceiling behind them, outlined against the glow from the cavern entrance. The cavern slowly widens into an expansive faintly illuminated basin filled with gnarled vine tendrils; Mike and Sal follow the beetles as they scuttle across it. But the route halts at an enormous crater in the ground encircled by tattered silk strands. The escort vanished into the crater, and unable to proceed, the companions halted a short distance from it. Mike raises the flashlight, uncertain what to do next, and Mike and Sal retreat as several long fuzzy legs appear from the crater, and a massive beetle as large as a freight train hoists itself above the brink and gazes down at them. It has a fuzzy visage and its tiny eyes are positioned closely together, and the companions gawk slack-jawed as Sal ceases his whimpering. Sal gestures upwards with a trembling arm, and Mike glances up to see scores of large beetles descending from the vine tendrils to dangle around their heads. He nods courteously to Balthazar, and Mike swings the flashlight but drops it. They brandish their sticks as the beetles converge. It's the Chevy Tahoe, and it halts with the doors flinging open. Spot leaps into the rear seat, Sal into the front, and Mike dives for the navigator's spot as the beetles assail. Dispersing beetles, Sal reverses the vehicle out around the vine tendrils and back along the tight cavern. The vehicle speeds backwards out of the entrance and glides through the air. The vehicle hits the terrain and grinds to a stop, dislodging the missing beetle, which grasps Sal through the open window. Mike brandishes his stick and the beetle is tossed backwards, and Sal gazes at Mike with relief. Mike's eyes abruptly widen as he peers through the fractured windshield to see hordes of enormous beetles emerging from among the murky shrubs and converging on the vehicle, poised to assail again. Sal starts the vehicle, shifts it into reverse, turns the vehicle, and accelerates. The beetles hurry close behind the vehicle as it lurches away amid the shrubs, and the surface of the grove is a teeming horde of beetles. Mike turns to Sal in exasperation as Sal grips the shifter, while beetles linger in the shrubs ready to pounce on the vehicle. Enormous beetles hover ahead of them as they both tug on the shifter, and the vehicle ascends into the air, crashing into a bough and dispersing beetles.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They are drifting into it as Janet glances around confidently. Zoe crouches and skips into the tunnel with Max just ahead, and singing softly, Janet pauses for a moment then trails her friend. The tunnel lies bright and quiet, making it difficult to walk straight. They do not notice a very small snake which slithers from the wall behind them, silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance. The tunnel gradually narrows out into a large brightly lit chamber filled with tangled vines; Zoe and Janet trail the snakes as they drift across it. But the path halts at a huge mound in the ground surrounded by scattered leaves. The leader vanished into the mound, and unwilling to proceed, the girls stood a little away from it. Zoe lifts the mirror, unsure of what to expect next, and Zoe and Janet shuffle away as several long slimy tentacles stretch from the mound, and a huge octopus as big as a freight train raises itself above the rim and glances down at them. It has a smooth face and its tiny eyes are spaced far apart, and the girls gape open-jawed as Janet stops humming. Janet gestures upwards with a steady hand, and Zoe looks up to see dozens of large snakes lowering themselves from the vines to dangle about their heads. She waves cheerfully to Jerome, and Zoe swings the mirror but fumbles it. They pull out their radios as the snakes drift closer. It's the motorbike, and it halts with the doors snapping open. Max leaps into the sidecar, Janet into the back, and Zoe lunges for the driver's seat as the snakes charge. Dispelling snakes, Janet maneuvers the bike out around the vines and back along the twisting tunnel. The bike zooms forwards out of the entrance and glides through the air. The bike hits the pavement and grinds to a stop, shaking loose the lingering snake, which lashes out at Janet through the smashed window. Zoe waves her radio and the snake is flung forwards, and Janet glances at Zoe with calmness. Zoe's eyes suddenly widen as she gazes through the shattered windshield to spot hundreds of giant snakes appearing from amongst the misty hills and creeping towards the bike, prepared to charge again. Janet revs the bike, shifts it into drive, swings the bike, and advances. The snakes slide close behind the bike as it bounces away between the hills, and the surface of the plain is a writhing mass of snakes. Zoe turns to Janet in determination as Janet clutches the gear stick, while snakes hide in the hills ready to leap on the bike. Huge snakes hover ahead of them as they both yank on the gear stick, and the bike lifts into the sky, crashing into a cloud and dispelling snakes.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: They are drifting into it as Ron glances around anxiously. Harry crouches and slips into the cave with Fang just ahead, and panting loudly, Ron pauses for an instant then trails his friend. The cave rests dim and glimmering, making it unwieldy to stand confidently. They do not notice a very large beetle which floats from the ceiling behind them, silhouetted against the glow from the cave entrance. The cave gradually stretches out into a large murkily lit chamber filled with gnarled vine stems; Harry and Ron trace the beetles as they drift across it. But the route halts at a massive chasm in the ground surrounded by tangled silk strands. The guide vanished into the chasm, and unable to proceed, the boys paused a little away from it. Harry lifts the flashlight, uncertain of what to do next, and Harry and Ron step back as several long fuzzy antennae emerge from the chasm, and a huge beetle as big as a double-decker minivan lifts itself above the rim and gazes down at them. It has a fuzzy expression and its tiny eyes are set close together, and the boys stare wide-eyed as Ron stops sobbing. Ron gestures upwards with a trembling hand, and Harry glances up to see dozens of large beetles lowering themselves from the vine stems to hover above their heads. He nods courteously to Aragog, and Harry swings the flashlight but lets it slip. They draw out their brooms as the beetles edge in. It's the Ford Anglia, and it stops with the doors swinging open. Fang leaps into the back section, Ron into the front, and Harry lunges for the passenger section as the beetles swarm. Scattering beetles, Ron maneuvers the vehicle out around the vine stems and back along the narrow cave. The car lurches backwards out of the entrance and glides through the air. The car touches the ground and comes to a standstill, dislodging the lost beetle, which snatches Ron through the open hatch. Harry waves his wand and the beetle is launched backwards, and Ron glances at Harry with gratitude. Harry's eyes suddenly widen as he peers through the fractured windshield to see hundreds of giant beetles emerging from amongst the obscure branches and advancing towards the car, ready to swarm again. Ron activates the car, shifts it into reverse, swings the car, and accelerates. The beetles crawl close behind the car as it jerks away between the branches, and the floor of the woods is a writhing mass of beetles. Harry turns to Ron in urgency as Ron seizes the gear lever, while beetles lurk in the branches ready to leap on the car. Huge beetles hover ahead of them as they both tug on the gear lever, and the car ascends into the air, crashing into a limb and scattering beetles.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They are sneaking into it as Carla glances around calmly. Dave dances and slips into the cavern with Spot just behind, and laughing softly, Carla pauses for a moment then chases her sibling. The cavern rests bright and shadowy, making it possible to sit comfortably. They do not notice a tiny butterfly which flits from the ceiling behind them, silhouetted against the glow from the cavern entrance. The cavern gradually narrows into a small brightly lit burrow filled with twisted ivy tendrils; Dave and Carla trail the bees as they glide across it. But the route stumbles at a tiny hillock on the floor surrounded by smooth pebbles. The leader vanishes into the hillock, and unwilling to proceed, the group halted a little apart from it. Dave drops the flashlight, unsure of what to ponder next, and Dave and Carla stumble forward as several short silky wings sprout from the hillock, and a minuscule butterfly as quaint as a tiny teapot balances itself above the rim and gazes up at them. It has a smooth snout and its huge ears are set far apart, and the group yells wide-eyed as Carla begins giggling. Carla gestures downward with a steady finger, and Dave kneels down to observe hundreds of tiny butterflies bouncing themselves off the ivy tendrils to hover beneath their feet. He bows awkwardly to Andromeda, and Dave tosses the flashlight but catches it. They draw out their handkerchiefs as the butterflies dance around. It's the blue bicycle, and it skids with the pedals spinning around. Spot hops onto the handlebars, Carla onto the seat, and Dave leaps for the backrest as the butterflies embrace them. Collecting butterflies, Carla steers the bike through around the ivy tendrils and forward through the wide cavern. The bike coasts forwards out of the exit and rolls along the earth. The bike brushes the fence and stops at last, shaking off the perched butterfly, which tugs Carla through the narrow hatch. Dave snaps his fingers and the butterfly is jostled upwards, and Carla glances at Dave with joy. Dave's mouth suddenly grins wide as he peers through the foggy helmet to witness dozens of tiny butterflies emerging from amongst the radiant flowers and drifting towards the bike, eager to embrace again. Carla turns the bike, sets it into gear, nudges the bike, and coasts. The butterflies flutter closely in front of the bike as it glides away towards the flowers, and the path of the meadow is a blooming sea of butterflies. Dave spins to Carla in excitement as Carla yanks the handlebars, while butterflies hover on the flowers ready to swoop over the bike. Tiny butterflies appear behind them as they both grip the handlebars, and the bike dips over the earth, dodging into a shrub and collecting butterflies.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Ron and Harry, with Fang, enter a dark tunnel filled with spiders. The cramped path leads to a large hollow with twisted tree roots and a huge hole surrounded by cobwebs. Holding a lantern, Harry freezes as a giant spider, Aragog, emerges. More spiders descend from the trees above, and panic ensues when Harry drops the lantern. Just as the spiders close in, the enchanted Ford Anglia arrives, allowing them to escape. Ron drives the car backward through the tunnel and into the forest, swarmed by spiders. After narrowly escaping attacks, they manage to lift the car into the air and evade further danger, scattering spiders in their path.

set close together and the boys stare openmouthed as Ron stops whimpering  They pull out their wands as the spiders close in  Ron starts the car puts it into reverse turns the car and accelerates

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: They pull out their wands as the spiders close in  It's the Ford Anglia and it stops with the doors flying open  Fang jumps into the back seat  Ron into the front and Harry dives for the passenger seat as the spiders attack  Scattering spiders Ron backs the car out around the tree roots and back along the narrow tunnel  The car hurtles backwards out of the entrance and flies through the air  The car hits the ground and comes to a halt dislodging the lost spider which grabs Ron through the open window  Harry points his wand and the spider is hurled backwards and Ron looks at Harry with relief  Harry's eyes suddenly open wide as he looks through the cracked windscreen to see hundreds of huge spiders appearing from amongst the shadowy trees and moving towards the car ready to attack again  Ron starts the car puts it into reverse turns the car and accelerates  The spiders scuttle close behind the car as it jolts away between the trees and the floor of the forest is a seething mass of spiders  Harry turns to Ron in desperation as Ron grabs the gear stick while spiders lurk in the trees ready to jump on the car  Huge spiders loom ahead of them as they both heave on the gear stick and the car rises into the air smashing into a branch and scattering spiders They are swarming into it as Ron looks around nervously  Harry stoops and goes into the tunnel with Fang just ahead and breathing hard  Ron hesitates for a moment then follows his friend  The tunnel lies dark and glow making it impossible to stand upright  They do not see a very large spider which drops from the roof behind them silhouetted against the light from the tunnel entrance  The tunnel gradually opens out into a large dimly lit hollow filled with twisted tree roots  Harry and Ron follow the spiders as they swarm across it  But the path stops at a huge hole in the ground surrounded by crumpled cobwebs  The guide disappeared into the hole and unable to go further the boys stopped a little away from it  Harry holds up the lantern unsure of what to do next and Harry and Ron back away as several long hairy legs emerge from the hole and a huge spider as big as a doubledecker bus holds itself above the edge and peers down at them  It has a hairy face and its tiny eyes are set close together and the boys stare openmouthed as Ron stops whimpering  Ron points upwards with a shaking hand and Harry looks up to see dozens of large spiders lowering themselves from the tree roots to dangle about their heads  He nods politely to Aragog and Harry swings the lantern but drops it
